--- title: "World Indicators — 2022 (Slides)" author: "Sherelle Li" date: today format: revealjs: theme: league transition: convex slide-number: true scroll: true execute: echo: false warning: false message: false --- # Title World Indicators (2022) --- ## Data Used in Slides # Overview - Data: World Development Indicators via **wbgapi** - Indicators: GDP per capita (USD), Life expectancy (years), Inflation rate (%) - Tools: pandas and matplotlib - Year: 2022 # Load Data # Summary Statistics ::: {#733418fe .cell execution_count=3} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=17} ```{=html}
indicator count mean std min 25% 50% 75% max
0 gdp_per_capita 174.0 17468.036627 23616.374008 250.634225 2589.209681 6788.136647 20981.717143 123719.658916
1 life_expectancy 174.0 72.919539 7.956882 18.818000 67.731750 74.133000 77.894226 85.708000
2 inflation_rate 174.0 12.742605 19.923911 -1.610680 5.361652 7.949251 11.840016 171.205491
``` ::: ::: GDP per capita averages about $17,468 with wide dispersion. Life expectancy averages 72.9 years, typically between 68–78. Inflation averages 12.7%, showing high variation. # Correlation ::: {#8ecd99f1 .cell execution_count=4} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=18} ```{=html}
gdp_per_capita life_expectancy inflation_rate
gdp_per_capita 1.000000 0.601626 -0.164250
life_expectancy 0.601626 1.000000 -0.068469
inflation_rate -0.164250 -0.068469 1.000000
``` ::: ::: GDP per capita and life expectancy are moderately positively correlated (r ≈ 0.6). Inflation shows weak negative correlations with both variables. # Life Expectancy vs GDP per Capita ::: {#db2f0e7d .cell execution_count=5} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display} ![](05_slides_files/figure-revealjs/cell-6-output-1.png){width=808 height=449} ::: ::: Higher GDP per capita generally aligns with longer life expectancy. # Inflation Distribution ::: {#f2af8abd .cell execution_count=6} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display} ![](05_slides_files/figure-revealjs/cell-7-output-1.png){width=808 height=449} ::: ::: Inflation rates are highly skewed, with some extreme outliers. # Top 10 GDP per Capita Countries ::: {#789e8950 .cell execution_count=7} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display} ![](05_slides_files/figure-revealjs/cell-8-output-1.png){width=863 height=449} ::: ::: Wealth is concentrated among a small group of countries. # Conclusion Economic and health outcomes remain uneven globally. Strong GDP–life expectancy link highlights the role of economic development. Inflation disparities reflect diverse fiscal conditions. # References World Bank (2022). World Development Indicators (WDI).
